body_html:
I really like the idea about adding dtype to the Tensor constructor #3202. Or similarly, you can add a is_cuda boolean to the constructor. My main irritant now is that I have to make the same if statement to check for cuda availability every time I need to create a new Tensor. So we can "cache" the result of that if statement into a boolean variable and just pass it to some function that will execute that if statement under the hood. We don't really change any behavior but now the if statement is only written once.

Looking forward to this change!

body:
I really like the idea about adding dtype to the Tensor constructor [#3202](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/3202). Or similarly, you can add a is_cuda boolean to the constructor. My main irritant now is that I have to make the same if statement to check for cuda availability every time I need to create a new Tensor. So we can "cache" the result of that if statement into a boolean variable and just pass it to some function that will execute that if statement under the hood. We don't really change any behavior but now the if statement is only written once. 

Looking forward to this change!
